issue.title: Standard library needs review for constructors to be explicit to avoid treatment as initializer-list constructor

discussion.p: Marking a constructor with explicit has semantics even for a constructor with zero or several parameters: Such a constructor cannot be used with list-initialization in a copy-initialization context, see . The standard library apparently has not been reviewed for marking non-single-parameter constructors as explicit.
Consider marking zero-parameter and multi-parameter constructors explicit in classes that have at least one constructor marked explicit and that do not have an initializer-list constructor.
Robert Klarer to address this one.
discussion.blockquote: Move to "Open". Robert Klarer has promised to provide wording.
discussion.note: 2010 Pittsburgh: Moved to NAD, rationale added below.

rationale.p: We are unaware of any cases where initializer lists cause problem in this context, but if problems arise in the future the issue can be reopened.
